ygData.subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Cable Modem question
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for all the info folks!  I m definitely finding the decision easier to live with now :) Mujahid
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for all the info folks! I'm definitely finding the decision easier
to live with now :)

Mujahid

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Niomar [mailto:Niomar@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, May 09, 2000 6:34 PM
> To: EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Cable Modem question
>
>
> Cable modem is superior to dial-up in every aspect imaginable. First, the
> simple fact that when your computer is on, your always on the Internet (no
> dialing, no busy signals, etc.). Secondly, it is a LOT more
> faster...whether you are surfing the web, downloading programs, or playing
> EverQuest; you will notice a difference.
>
> Yes, with Road Runner, it does vary depending on number of people
> online in
> your area (However, I don't find this to be a current problem), but Road
> Runner is under-going MAJOR changes right now. Just recently
> they increased
> their bandwidth in Kansas City by 300% and other areas with other
> upgrades.
> Some of the best techs available for all your problems too.
>
> To say the least...make the switch. You won't regret it.
>
> Telikas Recedas, Dark Elven Mage of Xegony.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Nat Russo" <nrusso@...>
> To: "EQ_Necromancers" <EQ_Necromancer@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, May 09, 2000 4:03 PM
> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Cable Modem question
>
>
> > Hi folks,
> >
> > I recently moved to a neighborhood where Roadrunner Cable Modem
> service is
> > available. I was going to just keep my 56K dialup connection,
> but due to
> > the phone wiring in the neighborhood (paired-back copper more than 15000
> > feet from a substation) the highest connection speed I can get is 26.4K.
> >
> > My question is this: Other than the fact that a cable modem connection
> > slows down with each additional person logged in, are there any known
> issues
> > with running a cable modem and playing Everquest?
> >
> > Secondly, will this faster connection actually benefit me in
> any way (with
> > regard to playing Everquest)?
> >
> > Thanks in advance for the info.
> >
> > Mujahid 26 Necro Solusek Ro
> >
> >
